qas.question: Who was deeply dissatisfied with Bazaine's decision to abandon Chihuahua?
How many men did Billaut have when he recaptured the city?
At its zenith, the imperialist forces controlled all but how many states in Mexico?
Which four states opposed the French?

answers.text: Guerrero, Chihuahua, Sonora, and Baja California

qas.question: In which year did Billaut capture Chihuahua?

context: <a0_0>Maximilian<a0_0/> was deeply dissatisfied with General Bazaine's decision to abandon the state capital of Chihuahua and immediately ordered Agustín B. Billaut to recapture the city. On December 11, <a4_0>1865<a4_0/>, Billaut with a force of <a1_0>500<a1_0/> men took control of the city. By January 31, 1866 Billaut was ordered to leave Chihuahua, but he left behind 500 men to maintain control. At the zenith of their power, the imperialist forces controlled all but <a2_0>four<a2_0/> states in Mexico; the only states to maintain strong opposition to the French were: <a3_0>Guerrero, Chihuahua, Sonora, and Baja California<a3_0/>.
